caption: I love when I can order online from a local establishment in favor of using doordash. The food was so good. The won ton soup broth was made with skill and care. The broth was so rich and flavorful, I'm not sure if I enjoyed the wontons or the broth more! The calamari was cooked perfectly, the szechuan won ton sauce had a perfectly spicy chili sauce, and I finally was able to find delicious ma po tofu here. I always tell delivery drivers to leave my order at the entrance door of my building for their convenience, but my delivery person went the extra mile and delivered it to my apartment. He was so polite and nice!
Not bad, just the rice was a lil dry and small shrimp.
Delicious! Got some fried rice and mapo tofu! Super easy to order and ready pretty quickly!
Great Customer Service Delicious Meal
The food itself is good. Decent Chinese food. However it made my family sick overnight. I think whatever ingredients they use is too fatty. Maybe I’ll try again and get something else next time.
The Singapore noodles and shrimp lobster sauce were really good!! I found a favorite new spot!
The food was ok.
Made Christmas great for all the people who had to work on this day
Quick
The rudest service. Especially the lady with glasses.
Awesome food. I've tried many of their well prepared meals and the taste is great. Friendly staff, reasonable prices.

Don’t order from here!  Hair in my combination fried rice, which, I paid to add extra shrimp and there was hardly any 😡. The egg drop soup lacks flavor, the shrimp egg foo young was pretty tasteless. This was my firs time here, I had high hopes but sadly highly disappointed! Not saving this place to my go back to list!
Good chinese food. Orange chicken is not spicy and it is interesting.
Beef and broccoli was too salty and wonton noodle soup was flavorless. Won't be coming again.

Really disappointing. We are new to the area and ordered from here yesterday based off of the restaurant’s high ratings. I ordered the peppercorn beef and my boyfriend ordered wings with fried rice. The peppercorn beef was just okay. I’m not sure the beef was even beef. It very well may have been pork. It was fatty and chewy and not totally cooked.  My boyfriend’s food was just meh.  We were spoiled in our last neighborhood being near New China Station which has much higher quality food at a fraction of the price.
Great food 👍
Everything is amazing every time!

This has become my go to spot for Chinese Cuisine. The vegetable egg rolls are outstanding, alongside the vegetable fried rice. Most of all the price you pay is not bad compared to other restaurants. IMO the food is much better, looking forward for dine in. Hence the 5 stars
Would certainly recommend trying this spot. Excellent ambience, delightful food, great customer service. Highly recommended.

Ordered for my daughter who lives in Chicago and she loved it. She said the food arrived on time and was still hot enough to eat. She also said the orders were cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor. She just moved to Hyde Park and said this may be her “go to spot.”
Nice food
Delicious food, massive portions, along with quick and friendly service. Delivery came in half the quoted time and everything was piping hot! Thank you Southside Ken!
Best Chinese food in chicago hands down. Everything is fresh. The flavors are spot on and after delivery still piping hot. Sauces, napkins and silver were included!! 10 stars!
The service was good but the food is just ok. The restaurant was much much better when it was Pho 55. Hype Park has a Chinese restaurant, SSK would do better to return to Vietnamese cuisine.

I ordered lunch on their website on 03/17 and I went to the restaurant at 11:30am only to find the door was closed and no one was inside. I tried to call their number but no one picked it up so I left. At around 1pm a woman called me and I explained the situation to her but she just kept saying it’s open now  it’s open now and I cannot be refunded because It’s an online order. How rude! Someone should close this restaurant down!
Wonderful food! Great atmosphere. Good service!

We ordered pick up for lunch and were told ready in 15-20 min. We got there after 40 mins and food were still not ready.There were nobody dining in the restaurant! Plus instead of just asking for the name, the girl wanted the phone number. I had to tell her 3 times until she realized I was right. While we had to wait there my son got Interested in the aquarium so we asked if we could dine in instead, the same girl just kept saying it’s to go it’s to go! We were gonna tip you! There is no need to be rude.
Food is simply delicious! One of the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten. Service is fast, either delivery or dine in. The Mongolian beef is amazingly tender and yummy!
Dishes come in large portion! Perhaps three dishes would feed four people. Chili dry chicken was amazing. Mapo tofu was less spicy than I expected.
Amazing rice & kung pao chicken! Potstickers also a hit!

I returned to this place a 3rd time today. I ordered wonton soup and spinach dumplings. The soup was not great but the dumplings were so I cut my losses. My total was $10.99. Since I did not have a great time this time around I decided not to tip but next time return to try something else and maybe it will be worth tipping. The short lady in glasses hit the glasses window hard as I walked out demanding I return. There were customers inside and already I was embarrassed. I walked back and she told me with a nasty look that I did not tip and I should tip. I told her I can’t tip and that I don’t want to put that on the card. She demanded I tip and I said well I will go get cash and bring it then. So I did and I returned. when I returned I told her what she did was embarrassing and not nice. I asked her had I been a White person would she had ran after me hit the window and motioned me to return? She was quiet and pretended not to understand. I added I did not tip because I did not like the soup and I don’t have to tip it is not mandatory not and obligation. I added I ate twice before and I tipped and you were fine so if today I did not tip between $1.56 and $2.20 does that cause you to humiliate me the way you did? She said you will not be served here again we will not serve you when you come back. I said why? All because I did not tip you? She said you just tip in a sit down restaurant and I said I am not obligated to. All the other times i did tip so what changed today? I said here is your 20% tip $2.20 of the 10.99 meal. She pushed the money towards me telling me to take it in an angry voice. I turned and walked away. You will say this is not racial you will say this is that but I see and feel what I experienced and no one should be treated like that. Not a Black not a White nor anyone who decided not to tip. I will not be belittled, humiliated and made to feel this way by this restaurant again.
High-class Chinese food in Hyde Park. Varied menu. Huge portions. Great tasting dishes spiced just right. Good fast and friendly service. BYO okay.
Kung Pai chicken is good.  You can order from the Lunch menu only on Monday and Friday... (very strange)
Care h.c f dynastic

Racist. Went inside asked for a takeout menu. Woman gave it to me and when I tried to ask a question she ran into the bathroom. The other woman and man there proceeded to put away stock and do other things. They left me standing at the counter for 10 min before I just walked out.
Great taste, fast service.

So happy to have found this place. I ordered take out from here for the first time, got egg foo young and orange chicken. Food tasted great, the portions were excellent, the prices very reasonable (the orange chicken sauce was maybe the best I've ever had). Sure, I only got some stereotypical american chinese dishes, but I was very pleased. They've established a great first impression for this return customer to try the deeper cuts on the menu! This is certainly going to be my go to chinese spot in hyde park.

Really good dim sum! This is a good Chinese restaurant to go to if you are ever on the south side of chicago in Hyde Park. The atmosphere is also very relaxing and you get to watch cute dog videos as you eat.

Foods are tasty and voluminous. Staff serve you in a comfortable distance. Your tongue, stomach, and cognitive system of sociality would tell your brain satisfaction. You can choose a pot of hot jasmin tea instead of water, which and kawaii home videos make me superly relax.
Excellent, tasty food and attentive staff!
Love the food. Always freshly prepared.
Love it so far I've only had the fried rice and egg rolls which are both excellent
Great handmade egg rolls!
Super quick delivery, great orange/sesame chicken, and the fried rice was awesome! Really good place.

(Translated by Google) One of the few Chinese restaurants in Hyde Park. It's a rather Americanized restaurant rather than a panda. The menu is really diverse and some dim sums are sold. It's a lot of food, so it's a little short if you cook 2 dishes with 3 people. The liver of food is usually not strong. But not much spicy food. It seems to have eaten most among restaurants near here.  (Original) 하이드 파크에 있는 몇 안되는 중국식당 중 하나. 판다보다는 아니지만 살짝 미국화된 식당이다. 메뉴는 정말 다양하며 딤섬도 몇 개씩 판매한다. 양이 많고 푸짐해서 3명이서 2요리를 시키면 약간 부족한 정도이다. 음식의 간이 대체로 강하지 않은 편이다. 하지만, 매운 음식도 별로 없다. 이쪽 근방의 식당중에서 가장 먹을만 한 것 같다.
We tried many dishes and it was really good. They are well priced and serve large portions. We ordered a lot to go home to eat. We will come back again. How can i want to give them six stars

South Side Ken Chinese Restaurant  Hyde Park desperately needed a non-Nicky’s Chinese restaurant and it seems this is current solution to that problem. We came on a Tuesday evening with a huge group. They served us tea immediately, which was really comforting for a cold Chicago evening.  First impression is that they had a HUGE selection of dishes here: Sichuanese, dim sum, Cantonese, Americanized Chinese, and... Peking duck? I’m always a bit nervous when a restaurant offers food from all over China rather than a specialized regional restaurant.  Since we were a big group, we got a bit of everything.  Warning: I’m a hardcore Chinese food purist and is admittedly very snobby about authentic Chinese food.  Peking duck: This was probably the best thing we ate while we were here. It came with a bunch soft pillowy buns, cucumbers, and hoisin sauce. The price for this was really good, far cheaper than most restaurants that offer Peking duck. The meat was nice and fatty and tender. There was lots of flavour in the duck. The skin could be a bit crispier, but for the price it’s worth it. If you come in a group, this is the perfect dish for sharing.  Sichuanese dishes: Jianjiaotudousi (Stir fried potato with bell peppers): probably the best vegetable dish we ordered. There was more peppers than I expected so the taste was more peppery but it added a nice crunch in comparison to the softer potatoes. It wasn’t spicy, flavouring was fairly light but it still tasted good. Mapo tofu: Tofu was pretty nice and soft. We had to modify the order for the vegetarians to make it no-meat but I was surprised it came with peas and carrots? Was pretty disappointed I didn’t taste any Sichuan peppercorn though. Instead, the sauce seemed to be more sweet and chilli taste. Should’ve asked for it to be spicier. Yuxiang eggplant (Eggplant in brown sauce): Eggplant itself was good, fried to be soft and tender. But the sauce was quite oily. Since the sauce is supposed to be yuxiang, I wish I could taste more of the vinegar.  Americanized Chinese dishes: I don’t normally order these type of dishes at Chinese restaurants so I have no idea how they compare to other restaurants'. For the crab rangoon, I liked this filling, the cream cheese flavour wasn’t overpowering. The egg roll filling was pretty meh. Both the rangoon and egg roll were deep fried, maybe for a bit too long, to a brown colour and a very crispy exterior.  Dim sum dishes: Xiaolongbao (soup dumplings): These were pretty standard soup dumplings, the filling had a good pork flavour and the dough was nice and thin. Wish they had more of the soup in the dumpling but I thought it was pretty good otherwise. Shengjianbao (pan fried bun/dumpling): First time seeing shengjianbao that’s pan fried on both side. The bun was sweet, which I didn’t expect at all. I might be just ignorant here because I've only eaten the street food version of shengjianbao and not as a dim sum dish. Filling was alright. Vegetable dumpling: The dumplings are essentially steamed potstickers. I wasn't a fan of these unfortunately. Both the filling and wrapper were kinda mushy, but it had been sitting out for a while when I tried it so it might’ve been better if I tried it fresh.  If you come here, get the Peking duck, and Cantonese dishes, since I think the owner and workers are from the Canton region. I found their Sichuanese dishes to be a bit off though, but maybe we didn’t order the right dishes. If you have a Chinese food craving and don’t want to leave Hyde Park, this is the restaurant for you. The prices are very decent for the portion size. Overall, I think this restaurant is a good addition to Hyde Park’s gastronomy scene. However if you want truly authentic Chinese food you’ll have better luck in Chinatown or Bridgeport.

Could be friendlier, but my takeout orders were delicious. I had BBQ Pork Egg Fu Yung, and Combo Fried Rice. Portions were decent, fairly priced, and in reusable, microwaveable lunch containers. I will be back! They were a change from what I am used to, in that they lacked the extra salt and extra grease that am used to encountering. I am trying to cut back on my salt intake, so these were great!
The food was so good! I am so glad that Southside Ken came to Hyde Park. There were so many people at the restaurant. The service is also very good! They are super attentive to each patron.
I had the Singapore rice noodles & beef short ribs and they came out very quick, about 5 mins, and were decent size and very delicious.

First actual Chinese place in Hyde Park! Was delicious food and wonderful people. Still a soft opening so I hope they can speed up the wait time. It seems it is more popular than they expected so hoping they can sort that out soon!

The first Authentic Chinese Food in Hyde Park!  Recommend dishes: Peking Duck. It relieved my home sick. It could be better if they change the Tianmian sauce (already told them). Rate:8/10 Shanghai juicy dumplings. Similar to what I could find in Shanghai. Rate: 10/10 Garlic pea leaves. The garlic flavor is awesome. Rate: 8/10 Mapo Spicy tofu. Soft tofu melt in your mouth. : Rate: 9/10 Braised beef noodle soup. Classic & authentic flavor. Rate: 9/10 Chicken w/ dry hot sauce. Large piece of chicken should cook more time.: 7/10
Nice soup, good prices for big dishes. The wait for food wss too long
